attributes.action: Overturn the decision to sell off Preston's historic Fulwood Barracks.
attributes.background: The decision to announce the end of the home of the Duke of Lancaster's regiment as part of the biggest sell-offs of military land any Government has ever announced has been met with shock, surprise and anger by the people of Lancashire.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.lep.co.uk/your-lancashire/preston/fulwood-barracks-to-close-in-shock-mod-move-1-8224299
The Grade II listed building has been home of the Queen's Lancashire Regiment for nearly 150 years and now houses four Infantry battalions. It also houses the popular Lancashire Infantry Museum, the largest Regimental archive in the north of England.
The Barracks is an important part of the history and culture of Preston and it is a vital link between the local regiment and the population.

attributes.action: Remove all tolls from the River Mersey.
attributes.background: The River Mersey will end up with 2 bridges and x2 tunnels that will be tolled in the next 12 months. The cost of the build, upkeep and repair of these huge national infrastructures have been given to the people of Merseyside. Who pays for the upkeep of the bridges & tunnels of The River Thames.
attributes.additional_details:
The bridges & tunnels are part of the national infrastructure and should not be the responsibility of the people of Merseyside in the same way the bridge to Skye is not theirs to pay for, the Bridges of The Thames are not purely for the people of London.
there are many roads, bridges & tunnels that are paid for nationally including the upkeep, I feel the same should be done on Merseyside.

attributes.action: Make Cystic Fibrosis a qualifying condition on the prescription exemption list.
attributes.background: People with Cystic Fibrosis often take 50+ tablets a day just to help them breathe and digest food. It's a life debilitating condition with an average life expectancy of 41, yet Cystic Fibrosis is still not seen serious enough to add it to the medical exemption list. Help us help those with CF!
attributes.additional_details: 11,000 people in the UK have Cystic Fibrosis. It's caused by a faulty gene which affects the movement of salt and water in and out of cells. People with Cystic Fibrosis experience a build-up of thick sticky mucus in the lungs, digestive system and other organs, causing a wide range of challenging symptoms affecting the whole body. It causes chronic infections often requiring weeks of isolated hospital stays, and many people may eventually need lung transplants. https://www.cysticfibrosis.org.uk/

attributes.action: Re-open Trafford General Hospital as a fully operational Hospital and A&E again.
attributes.background: Trafford General Hospital served south Manchester for decades, a couple of years ago the A&E was closed and since then residents in this region need to go elseware. After a personal experience the A&E at the MRI is overworked and understaffed. Re-open Trafford General as a fully staffed A&E/Hospital
attributes.additional_details: Trafford General is the Birth place of the NHS, I went back to the 'hospital' a few days ago and it's just such a shame, entire wards are closed off and in darkness.  The infestruction, the wards, operating theatres, the buildings etc it's all there going to waste, it could be fully staffed and up and running again in no time at all....  The NHS could certainly do with another hospital in this time of crisis and we have this place just going to waste.

attributes.action: Save Remembrance Sunday Parades.
attributes.background: Due to a change in policy roads can no longer be closed. Unless local communities contract a road traffic management company to close the roads at a cost of thousands of pounds. Government should provide the council or police with extra money for these events to take place. Or these events will STOP
attributes.additional_details: local communities are devastated that their local parade or remembrance Sunday service being lost forever. The council do not have the funds for these event to take place. The police can no longer close roads due to a change in policy. Soldier's, have died in 2 world wars and various other conflict since, we need to ensure they are remembered in a fitting manner. These parades need to be saved for future generations so they understand the ultimate sacrifice that was made by these men and woman.

attributes.action: Devolve the power to allow medicinal use of cannabis to the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background:
The UK Government controls drugs policy and has no plans to allow the medicinal use of cannabis.

The Scottish Government want to consider reforming laws to allow the medicinal use of cannabis.

This petition calls for the UK Government to give the required power to the Scottish Government.
attributes.additional_details:
Many jurisdictions already allow the medical use of cannabis for conditions such as MS, arthritis and others. A cross party group of MPs has also called for the UK to follow suit.

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/scotland/sturgeon-seeks-right-to-legalise-medical-cannabis-376m6mp7n

http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/14791145.Nicola_Sturgeon_faces_calls_to_back_cannabis_for_medicinal_use_/

https://www.theguardian.com/science/2016/sep/13/all-party-group-legalisation-cannabis-medicinal-uses

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to help fund Social Care instead of increasing Council Tax
attributes.background: The Government are seeking to increase Council Tax as a way of funding the gap in Social Care Funding. We believe that instead of further taxing already struggling families the foreign aid budget should be cut and the money saved to be used instead.
attributes.additional_details: In her maiden speech the Prime Minister stated she would be working for all those people who were just about managing. Let her prove it by listening to the people.

attributes.action: Help Save Children with Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Children with Neuroblastoma face many months of intense treatment but the chances of relapse are high. There is treatment in the USA that reduces this risk but that has to be funded privately.
The amount of money that is needed to pay for this runs in to hundreds of thousands of pounds.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of recent cases in the media where families of children with this cancer were trying to raise £550,000 to get this treatment in America. If the treatment is available to reduce the risk we should be providing that treatment here in the UK.

attributes.action: Stop all refugees to the UK.
attributes.background: This only encourages more to come, we already have enough issues with looking after our own people.  Help should be focused in the closest safe country.

attributes.action: Clearly Mark halal food products on the front of all packaging
attributes.background: Halal slaughter is cruel and causes animals unessasary stress and suffering. People should be given a choice if they want to consume meat products etc of animals killed in this manner.
attributes.additional_details: All Halal products should be clearly marked on the front of all packaging.

attributes.action: Use the Foreign Aid budget to reimburse NHS costs for treating foreign nationals
attributes.background: The NHS is under severe financial strain and the Red Cross have described it as a humanitarian disaster. The Foreign Aid budget should provide aid in the form of health care to foreign nationals visiting, applying to become a UK citizen or seeking asylum. This can be done via a reimbursement scheme
attributes.additional_details: All health care services provided to government run asylum hostels or other such establishments; 'health tourists' such as pregnant women arriving deliberately to have their babies in the UK or who may be suffering chronic disease and have no treatment available in their home country should be declared 'distressed foreigners' & a simple application to Foreign Aid by any hospital clinic or GP Practice who treats a foreign national can claim back the cost directly to their own budget from the fund

attributes.action: Make student loans available to Diploma Performing Arts students.
attributes.background: If you've chosen to go to University or Performing Arts College to study a Degree you are able to get a Student Loan. However, if you study a Diploma you are not able to gain a Student Loan however the prices are the same. Performers are struggling or not able to train due to no available funds.
attributes.additional_details: Performing Arts College courses last 3 years, the same as Universities. At 18 Careers Loan is available. However, this loan is only available for 2 years and once you have finished your training you need to start paying it back immediately. This isn't ideal for a new graduate who is trying to save as much money as they can to start their career. By having the student loan it can help throughout the whole 3 year course and gives the graduate time to start their career before paying it back.

attributes.action: Save St Albans Pubs! Reduce proposed 2017 Business Rates before it is too late
attributes.background: The average increase to affected pubs is 72% (over £27000 per pub). This is an unaffordable increase that will lead to severe job losses and pub closures. We are urging the Government to give additional rate relief to local authorities to ensure the protection of our community asset, the local pub.
attributes.additional_details: St Albans has one of the most famous pub scenes in the world and the pub scene is wrapped in our local history. We are the home of CAMRA and home to the oldest pub in the country. Pubs not only employ local people, they are a community hub providing a meeting place, local entertainment and support our local farmers and suppliers. We are also a huge supporter of local charities. If these rate increases go ahead we will lose our independent pubs and will destroy a huge part of our history.

attributes.action: Let airport staff carry liquids over 100ml through staff security & test liquid.
attributes.background: For ages now cabin crew and airport staff in UK cannot carry liquid over 100ml through the airport security but anywhere else outside the UK can. All they need to do is test the liquid at the staff security. Many unhappy staff spending a fortune or going without drinks.
attributes.additional_details: In France they do liquid tests on cokes or wines or anything taken through. Other European countried they dont do the test atal and trust their staff.

attributes.action: Recognise the state of Palestine now alongside Israel 100 years on from Balfour
attributes.background: Our Government should recognise a state of Palestine now giving practical effect to British Policy of two states, Palestine and Israel, to live side by side in peace and security enabling Palestinians and Israelis to fulfil their right to self-determination, 100 years from the Balfour Declaration
attributes.additional_details: Palestine is recognised by over 130 countries worldwide. The United Kingdom, a permanent member of the UN Security Council,  should now do so as a major contribution to a two state solution to this conflict. While our Government recognised Israel in 1950, it has still not recognised Palestine – despite supporting many United Nations resolutions, and European Council conclusions confirming the Palestinian right to self-determination. This is in our National interest and that of the region

attributes.action: Provide much needed Truck Stops across the UK with modern facilities.
attributes.background: The Haulage Industry carries valuable cargo. The UK in general needs more dedicated Truck Stops with advanced facilities e.g CCTV, shower blocks, healthy food outlets.Laybys have no facilities and are a last resort. Without HGV's our shops would be empty. Drivers deserve a safe secure resting place.
attributes.additional_details: Already there is inadequate space for HGV's to park up on their rest times.With the volume of vehicles forever increasing on all roads across the UK, this situation will only get worse.Many HGV drivers experience theft of cargo and fuel, even at well known Service Stations.Current services have not grown with the increase of freight on the road, and often have very poor and neglected facilities.Truck drivers are on the road for many days at a time ,they deserve to have decent working facilities.

attributes.action: Create a new cabinet post  'Animal Welfare Secretary'
attributes.background: The general public and a growing number of MPs want to see vast improvement in the welfare of domestic, farm and wild animals in the UK and for animals to have a compassionate voice in parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Responsibilities could include the desire to 'end long distance live animal exports', 'end caged hens and farrowing crates for pigs', 'introduce better meat labelling', 'have CCTV in all slaughterhouses', 'phase out non stun slaughter', 'have scientific evidence-based debate on badger culling and driven grouse shooting', 'strengthen the ban on hunting with hounds', 'prevent dog fighting and badger baiting and ensure higher prison sentences for perpetrators', 'ban indiscriminate snares' etc.

attributes.action: Increase funding for ME/CFS research.
attributes.background: At the moment ME/CFS is diagnosed by ruling out every other illness. Doesn't sound right does it! If you think it's full name Myalgic Encephalomyelitis hard to pronounce, living with it is even harder.

attributes.action: Stop vaccination with the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in our schools.
attributes.background: There is parental concern about the use of the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in schools. There may be a risk of inhalation of the GM viral particles to those not consenting and evidence shows that recently vaccinated children may transmit the vaccine influenza strain to others in their community.
attributes.additional_details: If it is true that non consenting children are exposed to the GM viral particles or to the vaccine strains of influenza in school, the Nasal Spray Flu Vaccine Programme would appear to directly contradict the Secretary of State’s declaration in The Health Protection (Vaccination) Regulations 2009. This states that 'there is no provision for imposing or enabling any restriction or requirement which has, or would have, a significant effect on a person’s rights'.

attributes.action: Stop the SIA charging £220 for officers to renew their licence.
attributes.background: Why should the Security Industry Authority charge people every three years £220 to renew their licence and an additional £110 for any other licences held. People should not have to pay this amount of money to be able to go to work.
attributes.additional_details:
The security profession is overlooked by this country and most employees are on minimum wage.
We should not have to pay to work, the government should fund this organisation and not the employees. 
Without security officers the country would be nowhere near as safe as it is and we should be treated fairly.
This charge is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Make political claims subject to advertising standards laws.
attributes.background: A company making false claims in order to sell its products is liable to prosecution. Any politician, candidate or political party making false claims should also be prosecuted.

attributes.action: Continue to allow reciprocal freedom of movement with EU member states
attributes.background: Freedom of movement has been a fact of life for Brits and Europeans for many years. It's a vital source of economic & social mobility for individuals, and one which benefits UK businesses & cuts red tape. Future generations should not be deprived of this right.

attributes.action: Provide Devon Education Authorities with the National Average for Pupil Funding
attributes.background: For many years Devon has been one of the lowest-funded education authorities in England. In 2016-17 this resulted in a shortfall of £290 per pupil when compared to the national average. Other schools are funded at much higher than the national average and who therefore receive considerably more.
attributes.additional_details:
Just before Christmas the DfE announced the Stage 2 Consultation of this promised national funding formula for schools. We had hoped that this announcement would bring about a readjustment in funding that would benefit Uffculme School given our historic underfunding. We are shocked and dismayed to find out that the result of this for Uffculme is a 2.8% decrease in our funding by 2019-20. This means that our budget will be reduced by £140,000. 

Help Devon Schools by signing this petition.

attributes.action: Keep off road motorsports vehicles exempt from compulsory insurance rules
attributes.background: The "Vnuk" ruling made by the European Court of Justice said that compulsory motor insurance should apply to any vehicle being used anywhere, for any purpose for which it was intended.
attributes.additional_details: The EU are looking at changing the current rules at the moment as a result of this judgement. The UK Government must do all it can to prevent off road motorsports from being affected.

attributes.action: Reduce the speed limit on single track rural lanes from 60mph to 30mph
attributes.background: Increased traffic using badly maintained single track rural lanes as alternative routes and for commercial purposes is putting unacceptable pressure on the infrastructure and rural population. The legal speed limit of 60mph needs reducing to 30mph for the safety of families, workers and other users.
attributes.additional_details:
The urban population of the UK 80% so 20% are rural dwellers. Why are 59% of fatalities in the UK on rural roads?
http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/road-users/rural/
Many single track rural roads are horse tracks over 100 years old, now supporting repeated commercial use by carriers, sat nav alternatives to the clogged main routes and increasing leisure activities. There are no pavements or lighting leave home on foot with a buggy straight on to a road with a 60mph limit - unacceptable.

attributes.action: EXEMPT SUPPORTED HOUSING FROM HOUSING BENEFIT CAP
attributes.background: Proposals to cap housing benefit for supported housing jeopardises the future of this essential accommodation, which provides a home for the country’s most vulnerable citizens.
attributes.additional_details:
The people affected include
•         frail elderly people
•         young people leaving care
•         women fleeing domestic violence
•         people recovering from alcohol and substance misuse
•         people with mental health issues
•         people with physical and/or learning disabilities
•         former military servicemen and women 

We the undersigned therefore call upon HM Government to exempt supported housing from any cap on housing benefit

attributes.action: Implement an Opt-Out Organ Donation System (as in Wales): LET'S SAVE LIVES
attributes.background: Marnie Brace was born with Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy. At 14 weeks old she went into heart failure & was placed on the heart transplant list. At that time she was the UK's youngest patient awaiting such surgery. Sadly, Marnie is just one of 6,599 people currently awaiting a transplant in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Previously, the government responded that opt-out systems 'might have the potential to deliver benefits' yet it had 'no plans’ to introduce it. Data from the Welsh Government confirms the benefit of the Opt-Out System implemented in 2015:
- 53% of organs donated via deemed consent (32/60 organs)
- Rise: 50% liver transplants; 19% kidney transplants; 63% cardiothoracic transplants
- 38% drop in patients awaiting transplant between 2010/11 & 2015/16
Opt-Out Systems clearly SAVE lives. Please sign!
attributes.creator_name: Sarah Barton (on behalf of Nick & Amy Brace)

attributes.action:
Mandatory training in education 
re impact of abuse/trauma on children
attributes.background: Children who no longer remain with birth families often have attachment difficulties & a history of witnessing/experiencing abusive trauma regardless of the age they were removed, this is rarely understood by teachers or school staff. This needs to alter to increase attainment levels for children
attributes.additional_details: NICE guidelines advise that schools ought to complete training regarding attachment, brain development & the impact of trauma/abuse on these, but currently most schools (primary & secondary) appear to struggle with understanding the needs of children who are no longer with birth families. This ultimately impacts negatively on these children's attainment & enjoyment of school.  We wish to make it mandatory for teachers to undergo training regarding the impact of trauma on brain development & attachment. Training should also be reviewed in order to ensure all teaching staff understand these children's needs.  Work by John Bowlby, Margaret Ainsworth, Dan Hughes, Bruce Perry, & Graham Music all provide detail about brain development, trauma & attachment.

attributes.action: All charities to now display the amount of admin and promotion fees clearly.
attributes.background: The charity sector has been infected by greedy promotional companies and business run charities taking well over their share of administration fees. If it was the law to display on promotional signs the actual amount used on charitable activities, the public and the charity would now be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year the charity commission investigates a large number of charity's for fraud. Forces charity's have been worst hit in recent years with the likes of Afghan Heros, 1st Knight, Support our heroes, soldiers off the streets and Local Heroes all being investigated yet very little action is ever taken. 

If the public can clearly see what percentages the charity will receive from their donation, the public can then decide if they still want to give or to choose another charity.

attributes.action: More inspections required and legislation for CCTV installation in ALL abbatoirs
attributes.background: The govt has no intention of banning religious slaughter we are told. Our custom of stunning is not being carried out all the time nor being checked thoroughly enough with animals suffering intolerably. Secret filming has proved this many times. Suffering must end!

attributes.action: Don't remove children from victims of domestic violence
attributes.background: Some victims of domestic violence have their children taken away from them when they report the abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Don't remove children from victims. Victims of domestic abuse should not be made to suffer more than they have already by having their children taken away from them, as long as their children can be protected from abuse.

attributes.action: Make it law to sell and use only silent fireworks
attributes.background: Firework bangs terrify pets, farm animals, wildlife and young children. For hours on firework night, the weeks before and after and at dozens of other events all year.  The British Fireworks Association says restricting sale and use would increase illegal activity. Silent fireworks are a compromise.
attributes.additional_details:
In  parts of Europe silent fireworks are used increasinlgy to protect pets, livestock and wildlife.  Collecchio, Italy, passed a law in 2015 that all fireworks displays must be quiet.
 The World Health Organization lists 120 decibels as the pain threshold for sound, including sharp sounds such as thunderclaps. Fireworks are louder than that and can lead to hearing loss..
Animals fleeing from fireworks often get lost, injured or killed. Noisy fireworks are not as colourful as silent ones.

attributes.action: Issue birth certificates for all babies born still from 16 weeks gestation.
attributes.background:
At present if a baby is born sleeping before 24 weeks you get nothing to prove they existed, if after 24 weeks you get a record of stillbirth which helps with statistics of stillbirths. Neither are birth certificates.

We want recognition for all babies lost after 16 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
We have lost two babies at 23 weeks, both were classes as late miscarriages. For Rory we have an official record as he was born at 23 weeks but alive (birth and death certificates issued), for Henry, he didn't officially exist as he was born at 23+1 but was born still.

I laboured both of my babies and I gave birth to them but only one officially exists.

We need to change how baby loss from 16 weeks is recored and recognised. Please sign.

We want recognition for all babies lost after 16 weeks.

attributes.action: Penalise DWP decision makers who give incorrect awards of ESA/DLA or PIP!
attributes.background: More than 60% of DWP decisions are overturned by Tribunals, which shows DWP and/or Assessment companies are in it for the money! Not because they care. Financial penalties would save millions of Tax payers money, They would soon get it right! Appeals should NOT be needed in genuine cases!
attributes.additional_details:
With Some 60% of Tribunal appeals for ESA/DLA and PIP overturning the original decision by the DWP, there should be some type of penalty towards the original Assessor and Decision Maker. 
Where proof is provided by the claimant that the health issues deserve these benefits, and the claimant appeals to Tribunal and wins, the Assessor and the DWP should have a financial penalty. Claimants are 'Sanctioned for missing appointments, let then be sanctioned for getting it wrong!'

attributes.action: Revise the child allowance and maternity pay for multiple birth families
attributes.background:
Currently there is no extra maternity pay for multiple birth parents despite the cost being greater.  
The child allowance doesn't assist either having the second child at a reduced rate.
Both of these should be revised to help parents who are already over worked by a multiple birth.
attributes.additional_details:
The stat maternity pay at the moment is currently between £500-£600 a month which for a single parent is a large drop in salary, but doubled costs (or greater) for twice as many nappies, formula, clothes etc. means that this money is not sufficient for the needs of the family. 
The first child receives standard child benefit, the second however is treated as if they were not born at the same time. 
Multiple births are natural but parents aren't helped with that burden.

attributes.action: Reinstate the NHS bursary funds for prospective 2017/2018 Nursing students.
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is that government claim there's shortage of nurses in the UK and yet they went ahead to stop the bursary that has been helpful for Nursing students to pay for their tuition fees .Government should reinstate the NHS  bursary funds to encouraging more people into nursing.

attributes.action: Debate if "Safe Standing" could be introduced to all seater stadia in England
attributes.background:
The most impactful recommendation of the Taylor report in 1989 was the requirement that all football stadia in the top two divisions of English football had to be all seater. 

Large numbers of fans still stand at football matches and would like to continue to do this in a safe and legal manner.
attributes.additional_details:
Taylor report - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taylor_Report

Safe standing article (admittedly with a rail seat firm) - http://www.joe.co.uk/sport/safe-standing-qa/91188

Safe Standing facts from the Football Supporters Federation - http://www.fsf.org.uk/campaigns/safe-standing/safe-standing-facts/

attributes.action: stop all uk payments of foreign aid & all further payments to the EU immediately
attributes.background: The UK government to cease immediately any & all payments made to the EU regarding membership & stop all foreign aid payments until such time that our own NHS is back to where it should be & can look after people who are sick in this country,
attributes.additional_details:
, The elderly can retire like the ones in the past did at a reasonable age so that they can enjoy their final years & not have to work till they die & finally make sure our disabled people have what they need to live & not be told that they have to work even though they cannot!!
Billions going out from the Btitish peoples pocket to the EU & in foreign aid
Top lawyer said we owe the EU nothing

attributes.action: To make Crohn's disease a disability as it's a life-time illness
attributes.background: My wife has suffered for many years. We are in a council flat with 1 toilet and life is really hard. We have requested 2 toilets as we can't even let the kids use it as she needs access 24/7.
attributes.additional_details:
Life is really hard but the council won't do anything as it's not a disability. We've tried to get pip but no.
You need your own personal toilet 
You can't work full time 
Once every 2 years min your having operations

attributes.action: Principles for negotiations with the European Commission for leaving the EU
attributes.background: Any settlement negotiated by the Government must also be ratified by the British Parliament. Negotiations must seek to maintain full membership of the Customs Union while also seeking access to the single market for service industries including the Financial and IT sectors.
attributes.additional_details:
While seeking access to the Single Market Government should seek to mitigate the effect of disproportionate total migration into the U.K. from other EU member states.

Further, in the absence of a negotiated settlement being ratified by Parliament the Government must put the final agreement to a referendum of the British people for a simple vote either to accept the negotiated terms for leaving the EU or to remain within the European Union.

attributes.action: NHS pensions for Dental Nurses who work in practices with an NHS contract
attributes.background:
Dental nurses across the UK are working in practices which have NHS contracts but are not entitled to an NHS pension.
Dental nurses are assisting along side Dentists who are entitled to their NHS pension so why not the nurses?

attributes.action: Government to prevent local councils cease funds to maintain bowling facilities
attributes.background: Britain has an ageing population. Withdrawing funding will result in older and vulnerable people in our society becoming less mobile and lose their only social contact.  We want our national government to step in to prevent the destruction of this valuable sporting and recreational facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Many local councils are planning to withdraw funding to maintain bowling greens.  This short sighted action will have a knock on effect of less mobile, less fit elderly people.  The consequences are an increased demand on NHS and care facilities.

http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/news/15039978.Bowling_clubs__under_threat__from_Bradford_Council_cutbacks/

attributes.action: Immediate dismissal of Iraq Historic Allegations Team and Operation Northmoor
attributes.background: Mothers of soldiers killed in Afghanistan and Iraq are "astonished and appalled" at failures to scrap criminal inquiries against veterans. Cases include a Taliban bombmaker who claims his detention for 106 days was illegal, despite troops' belief he would kill British soldiers if they released him.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/21/revealed-now-british-troops-face-criminal-investigation-over-tal/
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/22/mothers-of-dead-servicemen-to-demand-showdown-with-theresa-may-a/
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/22/british-soldiers-who-fought-in-iraq-and-afghanistan-face-having/

attributes.action: Give vegans the right to refuse funding the meat industry with their tax money
attributes.background: Veganism is the number one factor in saving the planet, resources, water shortage. Vegans are increasing every day and we feel strongly that our tax is used to fund an industry we find unacceptable. Vegans have the right as Article 9 of the EHRA states, for our views are to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: Recently the new five pound note was found to have tallow in the initial process of manufacture. This has caused outrage not just with vegan groups, the Church but also Muslims. This 'small' problem is now going to be resolved. Why then as vegans in our thousands have we not been given a choice in where our tax money goes. The meat/animal/war industries supported by a huge proportion of our earnings is entirely against our ethics. We therefore wish to question this as it is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of foie gras in the UK
attributes.background: Foie gras is produced by the cruel and sustained force-feeding of ducks and geese until their livers become enlarged by up to ten times the natural size. This frequently scars the oesophagus and causes their organs to rupture. Many birds literally burst or choke to death on their own vomit.
attributes.additional_details:
Production of foie gras is so cruel it would be illegal in the UK under several animal welfare laws, but it can be legally imported and sold despite this contributing directly to the exact cruelty we have laws to prevent? 

Force feeding begins when the birds are 12 weeks old, happens 3 times a day using a pipe forced down the throat, and lasts for 12-15 days. The birds are kept in small, individual cages. They can't stand, walk, preen or stretch their wings. 

And all of this for a 'delicacy'.

attributes.action: Teens and young adults with Type 1 Diabetes have a right to PIP.
attributes.background: Type 1 diabetes is a life long, life threatening condition. Current government legislation does consider it to be a disability for children aged 16 and above.  PIP would give them the financial help they need to fund the additional things they need to become independent.
attributes.additional_details: It is a proven fact that without the help and support of parents/health professionals and peers.  Adolescents would struggle to cope with the day to day care of dealing with the challenges of Type 1 diabetes.  They are more likely to be hospitalised and suffer damage to their bodies that come with poor management.  The policies of this current government, denies them the support they need during these difficult years. PIP awards would help these young people cope with the financial strain of daily living, and give recognition that Type 1 diabetes is a disability.

attributes.action: Prevent fracking in the village of Marsh Lane and the Town of Eckington
attributes.background: Fracking has been proposed in the area of Eckington. The people of the area do not want fracking to occur due to the damages that are linked to it such as Sink Holes, pollution to the water table, heavy plant traffic on small B roads and the eye-sore that it will cause to the local area.

attributes.action: Regulation of changeover fees charged by caravan site owners
attributes.background: Make it illegal for static caravan site owners to charge a fee in respect of change of ownership of a caravan where the sale is a private sale and the caravan site has had no involvement in the sale. Also to cap the fees charged where the site owner has sold a caravan on behalf of an owner

attributes.action: Ask the PM to explain the deception on the true legal status of the EU vote.
attributes.background: The Referendum was an advisory Consultation, not a binding vote. Noone neither Government nor MP's nor Civil Service, raised this fundamental point publicly before the vote. And have not confirmed it since. Why not? Was or is there a Conspiracy of Silence ordered by No. 10?
attributes.additional_details:
1.The EU Referendum Act 2015.
2. House of Commons Briefing Paper CBP-7212, June 2015, Section 5:
“Types of referendum:
This Bill ...does not contain any requirement for the UK Government to implement the results of the referendum, nor set a time limit by which a vote to leave the EU should be implemented. Instead, this is a type of referendum known as pre-legislative or consultative, which enables the electorate to voice an opinion which then influences the Government in its policy decisions."

attributes.action: Embed Armed Forces Covenant into law in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Armed Forces Covenant 2015 is a promise from the Nation to those who serve or have served in The Armed Forces and their Families to be treated fairly and should suffer no disadvantage due to their service. This promise is not being upheld Nationwide , the only recourse is for it to be made Law
attributes.additional_details: The Armed Forces Covenant has much to offer  Serving & Veterans of HMF unfortunately upholding the Covenant across United Kingdom is very inconsistent to the point in some areas of the Country it is not even acknowledged by local Government,NHS, ect causing some Veterans to become homeless and many others to continue to suffer injuries both physical & mental without adequate help or treatment at the moment enforcement of the Armed Forces Covenant is optional not Law a `promise` is not working .
